applicationTypes.name: ProductCatalog
applicationTypes.description: Web application with shopping cart functionality

applicationTypes.name: OrderProcessor
applicationTypes.description: Backend order processor using MSMQ (not in solution)

legacyPatterns.impact: WCF is not supported in .NET Core/.NET 5+. Requires complete replacement.
legacyPatterns.modernAlternative: ASP.NET Core Web API with REST/gRPC

legacyPatterns.impact: MSMQ is Windows-specific and not supported in containers. Cannot run in Azure Container Apps.
legacyPatterns.modernAlternative: Azure Service Bus, Azure Storage Queues, or RabbitMQ

legacyPatterns.impact: System.Web dependencies prevent containerization. Full rewrite needed for ASP.NET Core.
In-memory session state doesn't work with container scaling. Needs distributed cache.
legacyPatterns.modernAlternative: Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Cosmos DB

legacyPatterns.impact: Legacy project format with packages.config. Harder to maintain and migrate.
Legacy package management. Should migrate to PackageReference.

blockers.solution: Migrate to .NET 10 for Linux container support
Replace with Azure Service Bus or other cloud-native messaging
Replace with REST API or gRPC

recommendations: Target Linux containers for better cost and performance
Implement health checks for Container Apps
Use Azure Key Vault for configuration secrets

requirements: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
Implement stateless design with distributed cache
benefits: Automatic scaling based on HTTP traffic or queue length
Integrated with Azure Service Bus for messaging

complexity.justification: High complexity due to multiple critical blockers: WCF to REST migration, MSMQ to Azure Service Bus replacement, ASP.NET MVC 5 to ASP.NET Core migration, and System.Web dependencies. However, the codebase is relatively small and well-structured, which reduces complexity.

architecturalChanges.notes: WCF to REST, MSMQ to Service Bus, complete project restructure

legacyPatterns.notes: Multiple critical legacy technologies requiring replacement

businessLogic.notes: Straightforward e-commerce logic but needs careful migration

phases.name: Foundation Setup
tasks: Set up Azure resources (Container Apps, Service Bus, Redis)
Implement CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions

phases.name: Data and Models Migration
tasks: Migrate Product and Category models to new project
Implement repository pattern with modern data access
Port business logic from WCF service
Create shared DTOs for API communication

phases.name: API Layer Development
tasks: Create ASP.NET Core Web API project
Implement REST endpoints replacing WCF operations

phases.name: Web Frontend Migration
tasks: Create ASP.NET Core MVC/Razor Pages project
Update client-side code to call REST API

phases.name: Messaging Infrastructure
tasks: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
Create background worker for order processing

immediate: Create Azure resources early for development/testing
Set up version control and branching strategy
Document current application behavior for validation
architectural: Use ASP.NET Core Web API with RESTful design
Implement Azure Service Bus for reliable messaging
Use Azure Cache for Redis for distributed session/cache
Consider Azure Cosmos DB or Azure SQL for persistent storage
Implement structured logging with Application Insights
Use managed identities for Azure resource authentication
bestPractices: Follow microservices principles with separate containers
Implement proper error handling and resilience patterns
Use semantic versioning for API endpoints

technical.mitigation: Thorough testing, implement data persistence before removing MSMQ
Document all features, create acceptance criteria, parallel run
Load testing, caching strategy, optimize database queries

business.mitigation: Blue-green deployment, rollback plan, phased rollout

development.notes: Assumes familiarity with .NET Core and Azure
